comment: Been coming here for 30 years and it never disappoints. Yes you have to queue, but that's part of the experience. The crab is always fresh and the staff remember you. A proper Whitstable treasure.
Worth the trip from London every time. Had the seafood platter and it was incredible. The pink paint, the tiny space, the bustle — there's nowhere quite like it.
Lovely food, bit cramped. Waited 45 mins for a seat which felt long. But the oysters were perfect and bringing your own wine makes it affordable.
Simply the best oysters I've had in England. Friendly service despite being absolutely rammed.
I know everyone loves this place but honestly found it stressful. Too small, too busy. Food was good though.
Celebrated our anniversary here. The fruits de mer was spectacular and the views over the harbour made it special. Worth every penny.
Lovely upstairs restaurant, great fish. Service was a bit slow but the quality made up for it. The fish pie is excellent.
Proper special occasion dining. Had the whole grilled sea bass and it was cooked perfectly. Booking essential.
Beautiful building, great location, solid food. Pricey but you're paying for the setting too.
A bit underwhelmed for the price. Nice enough but I've had better value elsewhere in town.
Perfect casual seafood. Sat on the harbour wall with a lobster roll and a cold beer. Doesn't get better than this.
This is what Whitstable is all about. Fresh, simple, delicious. The whole crab was incredibly good value.
Great for a quick lunch. Queue can be long but worth it. Bring layers if it's breezy!
Lobster roll was amazing. Only 4 stars because we had to wait ages and there's nowhere to sit if it's raining.
Highlight of our trip. So fresh, so good, so simple.
One of the best meals I've ever had. The slip sole was extraordinary. The setting on the marshes is hauntingly beautiful. Booked three months in advance, worth the wait.
Our local Michelin star and it really is that good. The bread alone is worth the visit. Steve Harris is a genius.
Drove down from London specifically for this. Did not disappoint. The pork belly was life-changing.
Absolutely delicious food. Knocked off a star because the drive from Canterbury is a bit of a trek and it's not cheap. But truly excellent cooking.
The Neppy! My local for 20 years. Nothing fancy, just a proper pub on the beach. Where else can you have a pint with your toes nearly in the sea?
Came for the sunset, stayed for the quiz. Absolutely magical location. Food was decent pub grub.
Iconic spot but gets very crowded in summer. Best out of season when you can actually get a seat.
Most photographed pub in Kent for good reason. Had fish and chips watching the sunset. Perfect.
Great location, average beer. Gets too touristy for my liking. Prefer the Ship up the road.
The fish finger sandwich at lunch is surprisingly brilliant. Great views, nice atmosphere, friendly staff.
Solid gastropub food with good local fish. Sunday lunch was excellent. Will return.
Really enjoyed dinner here. Good vegetarian options which isn't always the case in seafood-focused places.
A proper local boozer. None of this gastro nonsense, just decent beer and good company. Quiz night is fierce.
Refreshingly old school. Good pint, honest prices, friendly regulars. The garden is lovely in summer.
Shepherd Neame ales, no nonsense atmosphere. Just what I was looking for after a walk along the beach.
Best chips in Whitstable, full stop. Been coming here since I was a kid. The cod is always fresh.
Proper fish and chips. None of this gourmet rubbish. Just good, honest, perfectly fried fish. Queue was long but quick moving.
Great chippy, prices have gone up a bit but still good value. Friday night queue is ridiculous though.
Day trip from London isn't complete without VC Jones chips on the harbour wall.
Lovely little spot. We ordered too many dishes and regretted nothing. The natural wine list is brilliant.
Mediterranean small plates done right. Felt like a hidden gem. Definitely book ahead.
Really enjoyed this. Intimate space, great food. A bit pricey when you order multiple dishes but worth it.
Best coffee in Whitstable, hands down. The cinnamon buns are addictive. Get there early for one.
Beautiful space, excellent flat white. Good for working on a quiet weekday.
Great coffee, lovely building. Gets crowded on weekends and can be hard to get a table.
My morning ritual. The team know their coffee and the pastries are always fresh.
Best brunch in town. The shakshuka was incredible. Yes you have to queue on weekends but it's worth it.
Eggs royale perfection. Great coffee too. Our go-to for a weekend treat.
Really good brunch spot. Only complaint is the wait time — arrived at 10am and still queued 30 mins.
Solid brunch, nice interior. A bit noisy when packed but food makes up for it.
Twenty taps of excellent beer. Staff really know their stuff and are happy to let you try before you buy.
Perfect pre-dinner drinks spot. Good selection, nice vibe, friendly crowd.
Great craft beer selection. Can get crowded Friday/Saturday but that's part of the fun.
A proper bookshop! Staff recommendations are always spot on. The children's section is wonderful.
Found books here I never would have discovered elsewhere. The maritime history section is particularly good.
Support your local bookshop! They order anything in quickly and the staff actually read.
Charming shop. Spent a happy hour browsing. Bought three books I didn't plan on buying.
Wonderful artist-run gallery. The exhibitions are always interesting and the building itself is beautiful. Free to browse.
Great space for contemporary art. Bought a lovely print. Reasonable prices compared to London galleries.
Love how they've preserved the old fish market character. Always worth checking what's on.
Cheese heaven! The staff really know their stuff and will let you try anything. The Montgomery Cheddar is incredible.
Got a cheese board to take to the beach. Brilliant idea, perfectly packaged. Will be back.
Excellent selection but not cheap. Worth it for special occasions.
Picked up an Epoisses that was perfectly ripe. They vacuum packed it for the journey. Professionals.
Brilliant local shop. Fresh veg, good bread, nice wine. Everything you need for a self-catering holiday.
Love this place. Local eggs, Kent cheeses, proper produce. The antidote to supermarket shopping.
Stocked our holiday cottage from here. Everything we bought was excellent quality.
Local legend. The calamari is the best I've had anywhere. BYOB makes it affordable for a regular treat.
Unpretentious, delicious, great value. The set lunch is a bargain. Been going for years.
Lovely Mediterranean food. Simple room but food is what matters. Book ahead for dinner.
Family favourite. Kids love the meze plates. Staff are so welcoming.
Proper greengrocers. Everything tastes like it should. The seasonal displays are beautiful.
Support local! Great quality produce, fair prices, friendly staff. Better than any supermarket.
Love the weekend market. Great food stalls, interesting crafts, lovely atmosphere. Arrive early for parking!
Good market but gets very crowded on sunny weekends. The street food options are excellent.
Found some lovely handmade ceramics here. Worth the early start to beat the crowds.
Keith is a legend. Fair prices, interesting stock, and he'll tell you the history of everything. Hours of browsing.
Treasure hunt of a shop. Found a beautiful Georgian tea caddy I'd been looking for for ages.
Exquisite contemporary craft. The ceramics collection is outstanding. Beautiful shop in a beautiful building.
One of the best craft galleries outside London. Bought a stunning piece of jewellery for my wife.
Beautiful things but prices reflect the quality. Worth a visit even if just to look.
Proper secondhand bookshop. Three floors of treasures. The maritime section is exceptional.
Spent ages browsing here. Good prices, interesting stock. Watch your head on the stairs!
The bargain boxes outside are worth checking. Found a first edition for a fiver once.
Great to drink local beer at the source. The Native is an excellent session bitter. Nice industrial space.
Good beer, nice setting. A bit out of the way but worth the trip. Regular tap takeovers.
Consistently excellent exhibitions. Contemporary coastal art that's actually good. Not chocolate box stuff.
Bought a beautiful print here. Staff are knowledgeable and helpful. Framing service is excellent.
Everything in here is beautiful. Scandi-influenced homewares, gorgeous ceramics. Dangerous for the wallet.
Found the perfect gift for a hard-to-buy-for friend. Well curated, lovely shop.
My local and I love it. Proper pub, proper beer, proper community. Quiz night is legendary.
Nice traditional pub near Tankerton. Good ales, friendly locals. Gets cosy in winter.
Proper seaside caff with proper views. Full English after a walk on the beach is just right. Scones are great too.
Traditional tea and cake with a view. Nothing fancy but exactly what you want at the seaside.
Best breakfast view in Whitstable. Cash only but worth finding a cash point for.
The cupcakes are incredible! So moist, such generous frosting. The salted caramel is my favourite.
Had afternoon tea for my mum's birthday. Beautifully presented, delicious everything. Book ahead!
Great cakes, cute shop. The brownies are dangerously good. Can get crowded.
The gluten-free cupcakes are genuinely delicious, not just an afterthought. Thank you!
The wine advice here is excellent. Told them what we were cooking and they found the perfect bottle. Every time.
Put together a hamper from here. Beautiful products, beautifully packaged. Made a lovely gift.
Quality comes at a price but it's worth it for a treat. The charcuterie selection is excellent.
Proper afternoon tea with proper china. None of this modern nonsense. The scones are perfection.
Took my mother here for her 80th. She was in her element. Beautiful traditional tea room.
Lovely for a proper tea. Dozens of varieties. Cream tea was delicious. Book for afternoon tea.
Nice selection of coastal-themed art and gifts. More accessible than some galleries. Found a lovely print.
The jewellery here is beautiful. Sea glass pieces that are actually tasteful. Great for gifts.
Stunning harbour views and excellent seafood. The platter was impressive. Proper sit-down dining experience.
Lovely restaurant, very good fish. A bit pricey but the setting is worth it. Book for window tables.
Celebrated our anniversary here. Fantastic food, great wine list, impeccable service.
Oysters and champagne on the harbour. Simple concept, perfectly executed. The natives are exceptional.
Perfect aperitif spot. A dozen oysters and a glass of something cold while watching the boats. Heaven.
Beautiful seasonal arrangements. They always manage to make something special. Delivered on time too.
Picked up a lovely bunch to brighten our holiday cottage. Good quality, helpful staff.
Treasure trove! Found a gorgeous vintage dress for a fraction of what it would cost in London. Worth a rummage.
Interesting mix of vintage and retro. Some great mid-century pieces. Prices vary — some bargains, some not.
Gorgeous homewares. Everything is tasteful and beachy without being tacky. Found the perfect cushions.
Beautiful shop, beautiful things. Not cheap but quality shows. Great for gifts.
Good for souvenirs that aren't tat. The local photography prints are nice. Kids loved the postcards.
Found some nice local books and prints. Good range of stuff at various price points.
Great chips to eat on the harbour wall. Fresh fish, decent portions, fair prices. What more do you need?
Good straightforward chippy. Queue moved fast. The cod was properly fresh.
The sourdough is exceptional. Get there early on Saturdays — the croissants sell out fast.
Proper artisan bakery. The sausage roll is the best I've ever had. The cinnamon swirls are ridiculous.
Excellent bread but sells out quickly. Need to get there early for the good stuff.
Specialist maritime bookshop run by someone who really knows the subject. Found a navigation manual I'd been searching for years.
Fantastic niche bookshop. The owner's knowledge is extraordinary. Perfect for nautical enthusiasts.
Old school deli. Proper ham sliced to order, fantastic cheese selection, excellent sandwiches for the beach.
This is how delis should be. Quality produce, knowledgeable staff. The picnic supplies are perfect.
Great selection of cheese and meats. Helpful staff who let you taste. Prices fair for quality.
Beautiful children's clothes and toys. Everything is quality — things that last. Great for gifts.
Found gorgeous wooden toys for my grandson. Properly made, not plastic tat. They gift wrap beautifully too.
Lovely shop but prices are premium. Worth it for special occasions.
Beautiful gardens with sea views. Perfect for a wander away from the crowds. The walled garden is particularly lovely.
Nice Victorian house and grounds. Good for a picnic or escape from the busy harbour area. Tea room is adequate.
Sunset dinner here was magical. Great food, right on the beach. At high tide the waves are practically at the window.
Good local bistro with excellent location. Food is solid, views are spectacular. Book for weekends.
The sea bass was cooked perfectly. Lovely relaxed atmosphere. Great value for the quality and setting.
Good selection of contemporary prints at reasonable prices. Nice for cards too. Staff are helpful.
Found a lovely coastal print for our bathroom. Framing service is good quality.
Fish straight from the boats. Doesn't get fresher than this. Great prices too. Go early for best selection.
Bought a whole sea bass that had been caught that morning. The fishmonger filleted it perfectly. This is why I moved here.
Worth the trip for fresh fish at good prices. Can be hit or miss on selection depending on what's been landed.
Good pizza with a view. Kids loved it. Nothing fancy but well executed. Gets busy so no bookings for small groups.
Solid Italian food in a nice setting. The terrace is lovely in summer. Good value for families.
Pizza was fine, nothing special. Service was slow when busy. Location is the main draw.
My local for 15 years. Good ale, good company, darts and pool. Doesn't try to be anything fancy. Perfect.
Proper local pub. Cheaper pints than the tourist spots. Nice garden. Sports on TV. What more do you need?
Maria has been cutting my hair for 25 years. She knows exactly what I want before I say it. Proper local hairdresser.
Old school salon with good prices. None of the fancy stuff but brilliant cut. You'll know everyone's news by the time you leave.
